org.gearvrf.asynchronous

Class GVRCompressedTextureLoader.Reader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.asynchronous.GVRCompressedTextureLoader.Reader
  • Enclosing class:
    GVRCompressedTextureLoader

    protected static final class GVRCompressedTextureLoader.Reader
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for reading big- and little-endian numbers from a header

    • Method Detail

      • read

        protected int read(int bytes)
        Read an int
        Parameters:
        bytes - Should be in range 1..4. Not checked, and bad things can happen if you pass invalid values!
        Returns:
        A little-endian number from the byte array

      • readLE

        protected int readLE(int bytes)
        Read a little-endian int
        Parameters:
        bytes - Should be in range 1..4. Not checked, and bad things can happen if you pass invalid values!
        Returns:
        A little-endian number from the byte array

      • readBE

        protected int readBE(int bytes)
        Read a big-endian int
        Parameters:
        bytes - Should be in range 1..4. Not checked, and bad things can happen if you pass invalid values!
        Returns:
        A big-endian number from the byte array

      • readLong

        protected long readLong(int bytes)
        Deprecated. Sniffers need to be very fast!
        Read a long
        Parameters:
        bytes - Should be in range 1..8. Not checked, and bad things can happen if you pass invalid values!
        Returns:
        A little-endian number from the byte array

      • skip

        protected void skip(int bytes)
        Advance the read pointer

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Set the read pointer to the start of the stream

      • getPosition

        protected int getPosition()
        Get the current value of the read pointer. In conjunction with setPosition(int), this can be used to 'read ahead'.

      • setPosition

        protected void setPosition(int position)
        Set the value of the read pointer. This can be used to return to a previous getPosition() after 'reading ahead'.
